meta_description: Mercer Union is a non-profit, artist-run centre dedicated to commissioning and producing new works of contemporary art, and providing an engaging program that encourages critical inquiry and conversation. We champion ambitious exhibitions that empower diverse Canadian and international artists in formative and established stages of their practice.
hours_text:
### Hours

### Map

#### 

1286 Bloor Street West  
Toronto ON M6H 1N9, Canada

### Directions

#### By Subway

Mercer Union is located one block east of the Lansdowne TTC station on Line 2 (Bloor - Danforth). Follow signs for Lansdowne exit and Buses. Upon surfacing, turn left towards Bloor Street West. At the intersection, turn left onto Bloor Street West. At the end of the block, Mercer Union is on your left hand side.

#### By Bus

The Lansdowne 47 Bus (North - South) stops at the Lansdowne TTC station. Upon exiting the bus, continue walking south towards Bloor Street West. At the intersection, turn left onto Bloor Street West. At the end of the block, Mercer Union is on your left hand side.

#### By Car

Located just north of Mercer Union, there is a parking lot flanking the Lansdowne TTC station. Please note: entry for parking is only available via Lansdowne Avenue. This is a three-minute walk from the gallery.

#### By Bike

We can easily be reached by bike! If you are travelling along Bloor Street West, please utilize the bicycle lockup located across from the East Façade of the building (St Clarens Avenue).

### Tours

Mercer Union happily coordinates exhibition tour appointments for schools and community groups. To arrange a visit, please contact: _[[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)__._
